climbs.name: Venus on the Half-Shell
climbs.fa: Steve Sutton and Chris Miller, January 1996

content.description: Interesting but grainy climbing past bolts and some gear placements.
content.protection: 2 bolts (3/8"), gear to 2.5 inches including the anchor
content.location:
Located 10 feet left of

Blast From the Past

,

an obvious wide crack.

content.description:
Located about 100 feet right of

Bumpy

on the north face of a free-standing pillar/spire. There is an incomplete project with three bolts on the boulder just right (south) of this climb.

Climb past some gravelly edges to reach more solid patina holds which lead one up and left. Rap off the south face via a two bolt anchor.

Kinda chossy but still fun in an odd sort of way.

climbs.name: Nuptual Sac
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tom Burke

content.description: This climb is on the N. Split Dome, faces NE , and is just in front of Bite Me.  It's not far from the parking lot, and has some interesting and challenging climbing.  The climb goes up a short crack at the start, then goes up steep, inprobable looking rock past some bolts.  There is a bolted anchor on top.  The rock quality isn't stellar, but the climbing is interesting and challenging.
content.protection: Small to med cams, and QDs for the bolts.
content.location: A few minutes north out of the parking lot of Split Rock, on the SW face of N. Split Dome.

climbs.name: In And Out
climbs.fa: John Bald and Clark Jacobs, December 1976

content.description: a somewhat contrived offwidth  you can avoid much of the hard climbing by stemming over to the route Big Boy.

climbs.name: Gynogroove
climbs.fa: FRA: T. Tech, B. Povolny, T. Gordon February 2003

content.description:
This fun, easy chimney/offwidth climbs the outside of the first crack/chimney to the right of the Big Boy/In and Out alcove. It is the chimney to the left of Bumpy. It has likely been climbed several times over the years due to its stunning visual appearance from the parking lot. In fact I may have soloed it in approach shoes about 20 years ago. Can't really remember. Senility has taken its toll. Due to the wavy nature of the rock, wide techniques are only needed in a very short section near the top.

First recorded ascent by T. Tech, B. Polovny and T. Gordon 02/2003
content.protection: Bring wide crack protection from #2 to #4 Big Bros or equivalent if you want protection while leading this.
content.location: From the parking area this wavy chimney is obvious and located back behind overbolted rock. It is the first crack to the right of the Big Boy / In and Out alcove, and is located to the left of Bumpy.

content.description: This is the dual crack system located midway into the "split" of Split Dome and is 10 feet right of CC takes San Jose.
Climb the dike system that slants up and left via delicate and somewhat thrilling movement.
content.location: This route is not located on Split Dome, but on the west face of a large Boulder just east of Split Dome's north side.

content.description: This is a hand crack on excellent rock.  It is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
content.location: Walk into the "split" in Split Dome.  This route is on the left wall.

climbs.name: C-Section
climbs.fa: Bruce Bindner and Em Holland, April 2009

content.description:
This climb is in the back passage of the first chimney to the right of the In and Out / Big Boy alcove... It climbs the narrow inside passage that negotiates the depths behind Gynogroove.

From the ground, climb easy terrain up to the Gynogroove chimney, then walk back into the cleft until it widens. Climb up through the chimney until forced to squeeze horizontally into an interior room.

This route is definitely not recommended for portly climbers.
content.protection: A few medium size cams are useful, but the route is mainly protected by pieces in the 6" through 12" range. Headlamps are helpful for both the leader and second.
content.location: Located in the very back of the first crack/chimney to the right of Big Boy. Descend through blocky jumbles on the back side of the formation.

climbs.name: Bumpy
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tom Burke

content.description:
An easy start leads to a high first bolt after which the climbing is sustained and well protected. Good moves on unusal rock make this a fun route to do when in the area.

The minimal approach and somewhat novel rock make this a route to seek out. One star out of five.
content.location: Located on the west face of Split Dome, just behind and right of Overbolted Rock, on a very featured section of rock.

climbs.name: Bolts With a Blast
climbs.fa: Rick Briggs and Alan Bartlett, May 1993

content.description:
Fun climbing up grainy scoops on this seldom visited portion of the rock.

Gear belay and scramble to descend.
content.protection: 4 bolts (3/8"), gear to 3 inches for anchors
content.location:
Located approximately 40 feet left of and around the corner from

Bite Me

on the Northwest side of Split Dome.

climbs.name: Blast From the Past
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Rick Briggs, May 1993

content.description: This, the obvious wide crack that splits the north side of Split Dome, starts as an offwidth and widens higher into a chimney; lots of grain on this one.
content.location:
Just left of

Bolts With a Blast

.

content.description: This is a grainy and unpleasant crack route, with the crux in the first 10.  It is not listed in the 1992 Vogel guide.

climbs.name: Big Boy
climbs.fa: John Bald and Clark Jacobs, December 1976.

content.description: This Starts about 15 feet right of "In and Out". Climb a left facing corner/wide crack, joining "In and Out" at the squeeze.
